Class FormController

java.lang.Object
unipd.edids.userInterface.FormController
public class FormController extends Object
The `FormController` class is responsible for managing the application's user interface and coordinating interactions between the backend logic and frontend components.

Responsibilities: - Acts as the Controller in the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture, connecting the View (UI) with the backend services. - Manages application states and user interactions such as text input, analysis, generation, and settings updates. - Provides utilities for manipulating UI components, including syntax highlighting, structure formatting, and progress bar animations. - Handles logic for displaying and interacting with different application modes, such as text analysis and text generation.

Design Pattern: - Implements the **Facade Pattern** by abstracting and managing interactions with complex backend systems, primarily through the `AppManager`. - Utilizes the **Command Pattern** for encapsulating operations like text analysis and sentence generation into discrete tasks.

  • Constructor Details

    • FormController

      public FormController()

  • Method Details

    • setFacade

      public void setFacade(AppManager appManager)
      Sets the Facade for the FormController by assigning an instance of AppManager.
      Parameters:
      appManager - an instance of AppManager, acting as the Facade for managing core application logic and services.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the user interface components and sets up the primary configurations for the application.

      This method is responsible for: - Applying the configured UI theme. - Setting up toggle groups for radio buttons. - Populating the structure combo box with sentence structure options and initializing its state. - Loading syntax tags used in the application. - Adding context menus to specific areas in the interface. - Binding UI components to respective layout properties for responsive design. - Initializing a timer instance for UI-related progress tracking or updates.

    • updateTheme

      public void updateTheme(String theme)
      Updates the application's theme and its related visual properties.
      Parameters:
      theme - The name of the desired theme to apply (e.g., "dark", "light").

    • analyzeClick

      public void analyzeClick()
      Handles the behavior when the "Analyze" button is clicked.

      1. Starts a progress indicator to provide visual feedback to the user. 2. Creates and executes a background task to analyze the given sentence with options determined by the user interface state. 3. Leverages task management mechanisms to handle asynchronous operations gracefully.

    • generateClick

      public void generateClick()
      Initiates the process to generate a new sentence based on current configurations.

      Responsibilities: - Handles the click action of the "Generate" button. - Initiates a background task for sentence generation with configurable input options.

      Design Pattern: - Follows the **Command Pattern** to encapsulate the sentence generation functionality into a task.

    • setPrimaryStage

      public void setPrimaryStage(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Sets the primary stage of the application to manage the main window elements.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage representing the main application window.

    • openSettings

      public void openSettings()
      Opens the settings window of the application.

      This method loads the settings window from an FXML file and displays it in a modal dialog. It initializes the settings stage, sets its properties including title, size, and modality, and passes the stage to the settings controller. If an error occurs during loading, an alert is displayed to notify the user.

    • radioPressed

      public void radioPressed()
      Toggles the disabled state of the structureComboBox based on the selected state of selectStructureRadio.

    • toxicityPressed

      public void toxicityPressed()
      Enables or disables UI components related to toxicity filtering based on the state of the `toxicityLevels` toggle.

    • vocabularyForm

      public void vocabularyForm()
      Opens a new window to manage vocabulary input.

      This method is responsible for: - Loading the Vocabulary interface from the specified FXML file. - Setting up a modal stage and binding it to the primary application stage. - Configuring scene properties, including minimum window dimensions. - Passing the created stage to the associated VocabularyController instance. - Presenting the Vocabulary window to the user in a blocking manner (showAndWait). - Handling exceptions and user notification in case of errors while opening the window.

    • useGenerated

      public void useGenerated()
      Triggers an action when the "use generated" button is clicked.

      Updates the input text field with the generated output sentence, if available from the application manager's output.
